Question: "this person's claim to fame isn't that he got there first," explains historian Martin Dugard, "it's that he stayed.".
Hints: This person traveled from Portugal to both Genoa and Venice, but he received encouragement from neither.
On 30 May 1498, this person left with six ships from Sanlúcar, Spain, for his third trip to the New World.
Veneration of this person in America dates back to colonial times.
